docs.title: Welcome to SpectrumLootToolSpectrum Loot Tool
docs.text: A comprehensive loot distribution and tracking addon designed specifically for the Spectrum Federation guild on Garona-US. Manage BiS roll counts, coordinate loot distribution, and ensure fair gear allocation with real-time synchronization across your entire raid team.

docs.title: ⚔️ What is SpectrumLootTool?
docs.text:
SpectrumLootTool is a specialized World of Warcraft addon that helps guild officers track and distribute loot fairly during raids. By maintaining synchronized roll counts across all players, the addon ensures transparent and equitable gear distribution based on your guild's loot policies.

🎯 Fair Loot Distribution

Track BiS roll counts to ensure equitable gear distribution. Lower counts = higher priority for loot awards.

🔄 Real-time Synchronization

Changes broadcast instantly to all raid members. Everyone sees the same data, eliminating confusion and disputes.

👑 Officer Controls

Guild officers get enhanced controls with arrow buttons for easy roll count adjustments and advanced management features.

🎨 WoW-styled Interface

Clean, intuitive UI that matches World of Warcraft's design language. Class-colored names and familiar styling.

⚙️ Highly Configurable

Customize interface position, scaling, transparency, and behavior to fit your raiding style and UI setup.

🔍 Debug & Logging

Comprehensive logging system for troubleshooting issues and tracking loot distribution history.

docs.title: 🚀 Quick Start
docs.text:
Get up and running in minutes:

**Install the Addon** Download from [GitHub Releases](https://github.com/OsulivanAB/SpectrumLootTool/releases) or use WowUp for automatic updates. **Join a Raid** The addon works best in raid environments. Enable "Outside Raid" in settings for solo testing. **Open the Interface** Use `/slh` to toggle the main interface and see current roll counts for your raid team. **Configure as Needed** Officers can adjust roll counts using arrow buttons. All players can reposition and customize the interface.

docs.title: Essential Commands
docs.text: /slh - Toggle the main loot tracking interface /slh status - Check your addon status and roll count /slh help - Display all available commands

docs.title: API Reference
docs.text: Complete API documentation for developers integrating with SpectrumLootTool or creating extensions.

docs.title: SLH Namespace
docs.text:
All SpectrumLootTool functions are available under the global SLH namespace.

-- Check if addon is loaded
if SLH then
    -- Addon is available
    print("SpectrumLootTool loaded, version: " .. SLH.version)
end

docs.title: SLH:Toggle()
docs.text:
Toggle the main interface visibility.

-- Show/hide the interface
SLH:Toggle()

-- Force show
SLH:Show()

-- Force hide  
SLH:Hide()

docs.title: SLH:GetVersion()
docs.text:
Returns the current addon version.

local version = SLH:GetVersion()
print("Running version: " .. version)

docs.title: SLH:GetPlayer(name)
docs.text:
Retrieve player information and roll count.

local playerData = SLH:GetPlayer("PlayerName")
if playerData then
    print("Roll count: " .. playerData.rollCount)
    print("Class: " .. playerData.class)
    print("Last seen: " .. playerData.lastSeen)
end

docs.title: SLH:GetAllPlayers()
docs.text:
Get data for all known players.

local allPlayers = SLH:GetAllPlayers()
for name, data in pairs(allPlayers) do
    print(name .. " has " .. data.rollCount .. " rolls")
end

docs.title: SLH:SetPlayer(name, count)
docs.text:
Set a player's roll count (officer only).

-- Set PlayerName to 5 rolls
SLH:SetPlayer("PlayerName", 5)

docs.title: SLH:AdjustPlayer(name, amount)
docs.text:
Adjust a player's roll count by amount (officer only).

-- Add 2 rolls to PlayerName
SLH:AdjustPlayer("PlayerName", 2)

-- Remove 1 roll from PlayerName  
SLH:AdjustPlayer("PlayerName", -1)

docs.title: SLH:IsOfficer()
docs.text:
Check if current player has officer permissions.

if SLH:IsOfficer() then
    print("You have officer permissions")
    -- Show officer-only UI elements
end

docs.title: SLH:CanModify()
docs.text:
Check if current player can modify roll counts.

if SLH:CanModify() then
    -- Allow roll count adjustments
end

docs.title: SLH:GetGuildInfo()
docs.text:
Get current guild information.

local guildInfo = SLH:GetGuildInfo()
if guildInfo then
    print("Guild: " .. guildInfo.name)
    print("Rank: " .. guildInfo.rank)
end

docs.title: SLH:GetDatabase()
docs.text:
Access the underlying database.

local db = SLH:GetDatabase()
-- Access player data: db.players
-- Access settings: db.settings

docs.title: SLH:SaveData()
docs.text:
Force save current data to disk.

SLH:SaveData()
print("Data saved successfully")

docs.title: SLH:ResetData(type)
docs.text:
Reset specific data types.

-- Reset all roll counts
SLH:ResetData("rolls")

-- Reset all player data
SLH:ResetData("players")

-- Reset everything
SLH:ResetData("all")

docs.title: SLH:RegisterCallback(event, callback)
docs.text:
Register for SLH events.

local function onRollChanged(playerName, newCount, oldCount)
    print(playerName .. " roll count: " .. oldCount .. " -> " .. newCount)
end

SLH:RegisterCallback("ROLL_CHANGED", onRollChanged)

docs.title: ROLL_CHANGED
docs.text:
Fired when a player's roll count changes.

Arguments: - playerName (string): Name of the player - newCount (number): New roll count - oldCount (number): Previous roll count

docs.title: PLAYER_JOINED
docs.text:
Fired when a player joins the tracking list.

Arguments: - playerName (string): Name of the player - playerData (table): Complete player data

docs.title: PLAYER_LEFT
docs.text:
Fired when a player leaves the tracking list.

Arguments: - playerName (string): Name of the player

docs.title: OFFICER_STATUS_CHANGED
docs.text:
Fired when officer status changes.

Arguments: - isOfficer (boolean): New officer status

docs.text:
Get reference to the main interface frame.

local mainFrame = SLH:GetMainFrame()
if mainFrame then
    -- Modify frame properties
    mainFrame:SetAlpha(0.8)

docs.text:
Create a custom frame with SLH styling.

local customFrame = SLH:CreateCustomFrame("MyCustomFrame", UIParent)

Apply class colors to text.

docs.title: SLH:GetClassColor(class)
docs.text:
Get class color values.

docs.title: SLH:Log(level, message)
docs.text:
Write to the addon log.

SLH:Log("INFO", "Custom integration loaded")
SLH:Log("DEBUG", "Processing player data")

docs.text:
Get current logging level.

Pretty-print data structures.

SLH:DumpData(playerData)  -- Prints formatted table

docs.title: SLH:ValidateData()
docs.text:
Check data integrity.

local isValid, errors = SLH:ValidateData()

docs.title: SLH:SendMessage(target, message)
docs.text:
Send messages to other SLH users.

-- Send to all raid members
SLH:SendMessage("RAID", "Broadcast message")

docs.title: SLH:RegisterMessageHandler(handler)
docs.text:
Handle incoming messages.

local function messageHandler(sender, message)
    print("Received from " .. sender .. ": " .. message)
end

SLH:RegisterMessageHandler(messageHandler)

docs.text:
Get configuration value.

docs.text:
Set configuration value.

docs.title: SLH:ResetSettings()
docs.text:
Reset all settings to defaults.

SLH:ResetSettings()

docs.title: Creating Extensions
docs.text:
Example addon that integrates with SLH:

-- MyExtension.lua
local MyExt = {}

-- Wait for SLH to load
local function OnAddonLoaded(event, addonName)
    if addonName == "SpectrumLootTool" then
        if SLH then
            MyExt:Initialize()
        end
    end
end

function MyExt:Initialize()
    -- Register for roll changes
    SLH:RegisterCallback("ROLL_CHANGED", function(player, new, old)
        self:OnRollChanged(player, new, old)
    end)

    -- Add custom UI elements
    self:CreateUI()
end

function MyExt:OnRollChanged(player, newCount, oldCount)
    -- Custom logic when rolls change
    if newCount == 0 then
        print(player .. " is now eligible for loot!")
    end
end

function MyExt:CreateUI()
    -- Create custom interface
    local frame = SLH:CreateCustomFrame("MyExtensionFrame", UIParent)
    -- Add custom functionality
end

-- Register for addon load events
local frame = CreateFrame("Frame")
frame:RegisterEvent("ADDON_LOADED")
frame:SetScript("OnEvent", OnAddonLoaded)

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Always check if SLH exists before calling functions
  2. Use the event system instead of polling for changes
  3. Respect officer permissions when modifying data
  4. Handle errors gracefully with pcall/xpcall
  5. Use proper logging levels for debug output

API Stability

This API is stable for the current major version. Breaking changes will be documented in release notes and deprecated functions will show warnings before removal.

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text: Customize SpectrumLootTool to fit your raid team's needs with these comprehensive configuration options.

docs.title: 🎛️ Settings Overview
docs.text:
Access addon settings through Options → AddOns → Spectrum Loot Helper or use the command:

/slh config

docs.title: Unlock Frame
docs.text:
• Default: Locked
  • Description: When enabled, allows you to drag the interface to any position on screen
  • Usage: Enable temporarily to reposition, then disable to prevent accidental movement

docs.title: Auto-Position
docs.text:
• Default: Enabled
  • Description: Automatically positions interface in an optimal location
  • Options:
  • Top-left corner
  • Top-right corner
  • Bottom-left corner
  • Bottom-right corner
  • Center screen

docs.title: Scale
docs.text:
• Default: 100%
  • Range: 50% - 200%
  • Description: Adjusts the size of the interface
  • Command: /slh scale 150 (for 150% size)

docs.title: Show Outside Raid
docs.text:
• Default: Disabled
  • Description: Display interface when not in a raid group
  • Use Cases:
  • Solo testing and configuration
  • Small group dungeons
  • Officer meetings outside raids

docs.title: Auto-Hide in Combat
docs.text:
• Default: Enabled
  • Description: Automatically hides interface during combat encounters
  • Note: Interface will reappear when combat ends

docs.title: Transparency
docs.text:
• Default: 0% (fully opaque)
  • Range: 0% - 90%
  • Description: Makes interface semi-transparent
  • Command: /slh alpha 0.8 (for 80% opacity)

docs.title: Show All Players
docs.text:
• Default: Disabled (current group only)
  • Description: When enabled, shows all players from database regardless of online status
  • Benefits:
  • View historical roll data
  • Plan loot distribution for absent players
  • Maintain continuity across raid sessions

docs.title: Class Color Names
docs.text:
• Default: Enabled
  • Description: Colors player names according to their WoW class
  • Classes Supported: All retail WoW classes with authentic colors

docs.title: Show Offline Players
docs.text:
• Default: Enabled when "Show All Players" is active
  • Description: Include offline guild members in the display
  • Visual: Offline players appear with dimmed names

docs.title: Show Zero Counts
docs.text:
• Default: Enabled
  • Description: Display players with 0 roll counts
  • Alternative: Hide players with no rolls to reduce clutter

docs.title: Sort Method
docs.text:
• Options:
  • Alphabetical (A-Z by player name)
  • Roll Count (lowest to highest)
  • Reverse Roll Count (highest to lowest)
  • Join Order (order players joined the group)

docs.title: ⚔️ Officer Controls
docs.text:
Officer Rank Required

These settings only appear if you have rank 0-2 in Spectrum Federation guild.

docs.title: Show Arrow Buttons
docs.text:
• Default: Enabled for officers
  • Description: Display ↑/↓ buttons next to player names
  • Function: Click to increment/decrement roll counts

docs.title: Button Sensitivity
docs.text:
• Default: Single click
  • Options:
  • Single click (immediate adjustment)
  • Double click (prevent accidental changes)
  • Right-click confirmation

docs.title: Quick Adjustment Amount
docs.text:
• Default: 1 roll per click
  • Range: 1-5 rolls
  • Description: How many rolls each button click adjusts
  • Command: /slh clickvalue 2 (for 2 rolls per click)

docs.title: Auto-Sync Changes
docs.text:
• Default: Enabled
  • Description: Automatically broadcast changes to other addon users
  • Network: Uses addon communication channels

docs.title: Sync Permissions
docs.text:
• Default: Officer+ only
  • Description: Who can make and receive synchronization updates
  • Security: Prevents unauthorized roll modifications

docs.title: Debug Level
docs.text:
• Default: Info
  • Options:
  • Error: Only critical errors
  • Warning: Errors and warnings
  • Info: General information messages
  • Debug: Detailed debugging information
  • Trace: Extremely verbose logging

docs.title: Log to Chat
docs.text:
• Default: Enabled
  • Description: Display log messages in chat window
  • Channel: Uses a dedicated chat channel or system messages

docs.title: Log to File
docs.text:
• Default: Disabled
  • Description: Save logs to SavedVariables for export
  • File: Stored in WoW's SavedVariables folder

docs.title: Update Frequency
docs.text:
• Default: Real-time
  • Options:
  • Real-time (immediate updates)
  • Every 5 seconds
  • Every 10 seconds
  • Manual refresh only

docs.title: Memory Management
docs.text:
• Default: Auto-cleanup enabled
  • Description: Automatically removes old data to prevent memory leaks
  • Threshold: Cleans data older than 30 days

docs.title: Color Scheme
docs.text:
• Default: WoW Default
  • Options:
  • WoW Default (blue/gold theme)

  • High Contrast (accessibility)
  • Custom Colors (user-defined)

docs.title: Font Settings
docs.text:
• Default: System font

  • Friz Quadrata (WoW default)
  • Arial
  • Morpheus (WoW header font)
  • Custom font (if available)

docs.title: Border Style
docs.text:
• Default: WoW dialog style
  • Options:
  • WoW Dialog (standard)
  • Thin border
  • No border
  • Custom texture

docs.title: Data Retention
docs.text:
• Default: 90 days
  • Range: 7 days - 1 year

  • Command: /slh retention 30 (for 30 days)

docs.title: Backup Settings
docs.text:

  • Frequency: Daily backups, keep last 7

docs.title: Reset Options
docs.text:
Various reset commands for data management:

/slh reset current    # Reset current session only
/slh reset player PlayerName    # Reset specific player
/slh reset all        # Reset all data (requires confirmation)

docs.text:
Create custom shortcuts for frequently used commands:

/slh alias "st" "status"           # /slh st = /slh status

docs.text:
Example macros for common operations:

# Quick officer roll adjustment

docs.title: Profile Management
docs.text:
Save and load different configurations:

/slh profile load "RaidNight"      # Load saved settings
/slh profile list                  # Show available profiles

docs.title: Reset to Defaults
docs.text:
If settings become corrupted:

/slh config reset     # Reset to default settings
/reload               # Reload UI to apply changes

docs.title: Export/Import Settings
docs.text:
Share configurations with other officers:

/slh config export    # Creates exportable string
/slh config import "ConfigString"    # Import shared config

docs.title: Diagnostic Commands
docs.text:
Debug configuration issues:

/slh config validate  # Check for configuration errors
/slh config debug     # Show detailed config information

Save Your Settings

Configuration changes are automatically saved to your character's SavedVariables. Use /reload if settings don't seem to apply immediately.

docs.title: Database System
docs.text: The Spectrum Loot Helper includes a comprehensive database system for persistent player data storage. This system manages player information including equipment, Venarii charges, and other critical raid data.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The Database module provides: - Persistent Storage: All data is automatically saved to your WoW saved variables - Version Management: Automatic handling of WoW version updates and expansions - Data Validation: Comprehensive validation to ensure data integrity - Performance Optimization: Intelligent caching for frequently accessed data

docs.title: Database Information
docs.text:
/slh database info
Displays current database statistics including: - Total player entries - Database version - Memory usage - Cache performance

docs.title: Database Validation
docs.text:
/slh database validate
Runs a comprehensive validation check on all stored data and reports any issues.

docs.title: Database Export
docs.text:
/slh database export
Exports sanitized database information for debugging purposes (sensitive data is anonymized).

docs.title: Database Reset
docs.text:
/slh database reset
⚠️ WARNING: Completely clears all database entries. This action cannot be undone!

docs.title: Performance Optimization
docs.text:
/slh database optimize
Manually triggers database optimization including cache cleanup and performance tuning.

docs.title: API Functions for Developers
docs.text: If you're developing addon extensions or want to integrate with the database, these functions are available:

docs.title: Initialize Database
docs.text:
SLH.Database:Init()
Initializes the database system. Called automatically when the addon loads.

docs.title: Get Player Key
docs.text:
local playerKey = SLH.Database:GetCurrentPlayerKey()
Returns the unique key for the current player in format: PlayerName-ServerName-WoWVersion

docs.title: Add New Entry
docs.text:
local success, result = SLH.Database:AddEntry(playerName, serverName, wowVersion, initialData)
Creates a new player entry with the specified data.

docs.title: Retrieve Entry
docs.text:
local playerData = SLH.Database:GetEntry(playerKey)
Retrieves stored data for a specific player.

docs.title: Update Entry
docs.text:
local success, result = SLH.Database:UpdateEntry(playerName, serverName, wowVersion, updateData)
Updates existing player data with new information.

docs.title: Delete Entry
docs.text:
local success, result = SLH.Database:DeleteEntry(playerKey)
Removes a player entry from the database.

docs.title: Validate Venarii Charges
docs.text:
local isValid = SLH.Database:ValidateVenariiCharges(charges)
Validates that Venarii charges are within acceptable ranges (0-99).

docs.title: Validate Equipment
docs.text:
local isValid = SLH.Database:ValidateEquipment(equipmentData)
Validates equipment data structure for all 16 equipment slots.

docs.title: Validate Complete Entry
docs.text:
local isValid, errors = SLH.Database:ValidateEntry(entryData)
Performs comprehensive validation on a complete player data entry.

docs.title: Get Database Statistics
docs.text:
local stats = SLH.Database:GetDebugStats()
Returns detailed statistics about database performance and usage.

docs.title: Check Data Integrity
docs.text:
local isHealthy, issues = SLH.Database:CheckDataIntegrity()
Performs a health check on all stored data and reports any corruption.

docs.title: Get Database Size
docs.text:
local size = SLH.Database:GetSize()
Returns the current number of entries in the database.

docs.title: Clear All Data
docs.text:
SLH.Database:ClearAllData()
⚠️ WARNING: Removes all stored data. Use with extreme caution!

docs.title: Player Entry Schema
docs.text:
Each player entry contains: 

{
    playerName = "CharacterName",
    serverName = "ServerName", 
    wowVersion = "11.0",
    timestamp = 1234567890,
    venariiCharges = 25,
    equipment = {
        [1] = { -- Head slot
            itemLink = "[Item Link]",
            needsUpgrade = true,
            -- Additional equipment data
        },
        -- ... entries for all 16 equipment slots
    },
    metadata = {
        lastUpdated = 1234567890,
        version = "0.3.0"
    }
}

docs.title: Equipment Slots
docs.text: The system tracks all 16 equipment slots: 1. Head, 2. Neck, 3. Shoulder, 4. Shirt, 5. Chest 6. Waist, 7. Legs, 8. Feet, 9. Wrist, 10. Hands 11. Finger 1, 12. Finger 2, 13. Trinket 1, 14. Trinket 2 15. Back, 16. Main Hand, 17. Off Hand, 18. Ranged

docs.title: Version Management
docs.text: The database automatically handles WoW version updates: - Major.Minor Format: Uses format like "11.0" instead of full patch versions - Automatic Migration: Seamlessly migrates data when expansions release - Backward Compatibility: Maintains compatibility with older data formats

docs.title: Caching System
docs.text:
• Frequently accessed player keys are cached for faster retrieval
  • Cache is automatically managed and cleared when needed
  • Performance statistics available via /slh database info

docs.title: Memory Optimization
docs.text:
• Efficient data storage minimizes memory footprint
  • Automatic cleanup of temporary data
  • Optimized for raid environments with many players

docs.title: Common Issues
docs.text:
Database Not Loading - Ensure addon is enabled and loaded properly - Check for Lua errors in game console - Try /slh database validate to check for corruption

Performance Issues - Run /slh database optimize to clean up cache - Consider reducing debug logging level - Check available addon memory in game

Data Corruption - Run /slh database validate to identify issues - Export data with /slh database export before making changes - Contact addon developers with exported data for assistance

docs.title: Debug Information
docs.text: For troubleshooting, provide: 1. Output from /slh database info 2. Output from /slh database validate 3. Any relevant error messages from /console scriptErrors 1

docs.title: Safety Features
docs.text:
• Automatic Backups: Critical operations create automatic backups
  • Validation Checks: All data is validated before storage
  • Error Handling: Graceful degradation when issues occur
  • Data Sanitization: Exported data removes sensitive information

The database system is designed to be robust, performant, and safe for use in demanding raid environments while providing powerful tools for data management and debugging.

docs.title: Debug System
docs.text: SpectrumLootTool includes a sophisticated debug system designed to help users troubleshoot issues, monitor performance, and provide comprehensive bug reports. The debug system is mandatory for all addon functions and provides detailed logging capabilities.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The Debug module provides: - Multi-level Logging: Support for INFO, WARN, ERROR, and DEBUG log levels - Session Management: Automatic session tracking with timing and statistics - Performance Monitoring: Real-time performance metrics and optimization tools - Memory Management: Intelligent buffer management with automatic cleanup - Export Functionality: Complete bug report generation for issue reporting - Integration Testing: Comprehensive test suite for system validation

docs.title: Enabling Debug Logging
docs.text:
Debug logging is disabled by default to minimize performance impact. Enable it when you need detailed information:

/slh debuglog on

Or toggle it on/off: 

/slh debuglog toggle

To disable debug logging: 

/slh debuglog off

docs.title: Viewing Debug Logs
docs.text:
Display recent debug logs in chat: 

/slh debuglog show

Show a specific number of entries: 

/slh debuglog show 25

docs.title: Managing Debug Data
docs.text:
Clear all current debug logs: 

/slh debuglog clear

View debug system statistics: 

/slh debuglog stats

docs.title: Basic Commands
docs.text: Command Description /slh debuglog on Enable debug logging /slh debuglog off Disable debug logging /slh debuglog toggle Toggle debug logging state /slh debuglog show [count] Display recent logs (default: 10 entries) /slh debuglog clear Clear all current session logs /slh debuglog stats Show debug system statistics /slh debuglog export Generate bug report export

docs.title: Integration Testing
docs.text:
Test core addon functionality: 

/slh debuglog test core      # Test core functionality
/slh debuglog test ui        # Test user interface
/slh debuglog test workflow  # Test user workflows
/slh debuglog test perf      # Test performance
/slh debuglog test all       # Run all tests

docs.title: Performance Optimization
docs.text:
Monitor and optimize performance: 

/slh debuglog optimize run              # Apply optimizations
/slh debuglog optimize memory           # Manage memory usage
/slh debuglog optimize monitor [time]   # Monitor for specified seconds

docs.title: System Validation
docs.text:
Validate system integrity: 

/slh debuglog verify        # Run completeness verification
/slh debuglog errors        # Test error handling
/slh debuglog wow          # Check WoW compatibility
/slh debuglog performance  # Assess performance impact

docs.title: INFO Level
docs.text:
• Purpose: General information about addon operations
  • Examples: Function entry/exit, successful operations, state changes
  • Usage: Default level for tracking normal addon behavior

docs.title: WARN Level
docs.text:
• Purpose: Warnings that don't halt execution but indicate potential issues
  • Examples: Deprecated API usage, recoverable errors, unusual conditions
  • Usage: Identifies areas that may need attention

docs.title: ERROR Level
docs.text:
• Purpose: Errors that affect functionality but don't crash the addon
  • Examples: Failed operations, invalid data, API errors
  • Usage: Critical for debugging functional issues

docs.title: DEBUG Level
docs.text:
• Purpose: Detailed debugging information (most verbose)
  • Examples: Variable states, detailed execution paths, performance metrics
  • Usage: Deep troubleshooting and development debugging

docs.title: Memory Management
docs.text: The debug system automatically manages memory usage: - Buffer Limit: Maximum 1,000 log entries in memory - Automatic Cleanup: Oldest entries are removed when limit is reached - Memory Monitoring: Real-time memory usage tracking and reporting

docs.title: Performance Impact
docs.text:
• When Disabled: Virtually no performance impact (fast early returns)
  • When Enabled: Minimal impact during normal operation
  • High-Frequency Logging: Monitor performance during intensive operations

docs.title: Optimization Features
docs.text:
• Intelligent Filtering: Log only relevant information based on current needs
  • Session-Based: Logs are cleared between game sessions
  • Efficient Storage: Optimized data structures for minimal memory footprint

docs.title: Generating Bug Reports
docs.text:
When reporting issues, use the export function to generate comprehensive reports:

/slh debuglog export

This creates a detailed report including: - System Information: WoW version, addon version, player details - Session Data: Session duration, group status, debug statistics - Recent Logs: Last 50 debug entries with full context - Performance Metrics: Memory usage, logging statistics

docs.title: What to Include
docs.text: When submitting bug reports, always include: 1. Full debug export (generated with /slh debuglog export) 2. Steps to reproduce the issue 3. Expected vs actual behavior 4. When the issue occurs (specific situations, triggers) 5. Any error messages seen in-game

docs.title: Privacy and Security
docs.text: The debug export function: - Anonymizes sensitive data where possible - Includes only addon-related information - Does not capture chat content or personal data - Focuses on technical debugging information

docs.title: For Developers
docs.text:
Every function in SpectrumLootTool includes mandatory debug logging:

function SLH:ExampleFunction(param)
    self.Debug:LogDebug("Core", "Function entry", { param = param })
    -- function logic
    if errorCondition then
        self.Debug:LogError("Core", "Error occurred", { details = details })
    end
    self.Debug:LogInfo("Core", "Completed", { result = result })
end

docs.title: Component Names
docs.text: Debug logs use component names matching file names: - Core: Main logic and initialization - UI: User interface and events - Database: Data management and storage - Log: Roll tracking functionality - Debug: Debug system itself

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
• Always include context data in the third parameter
  • Use appropriate log levels for different types of information
  • Test with debug verification: /slh debuglog verify
  • Monitor performance impact: /slh debuglog performance

docs.title: Common Issues
docs.text:
Debug logs not appearing: - Ensure debug logging is enabled: /slh debuglog on - Check if logs were cleared: /slh debuglog stats - Verify addon is functioning: /slh status

Performance concerns: - Check current impact: /slh debuglog performance - Monitor memory usage: /slh debuglog stats - Run optimization: /slh debuglog optimize run

Export not working: - Ensure debug logging has been enabled and used - Check for recent log entries: /slh debuglog show - Verify saved variables are functioning

docs.title: Getting Help
docs.text:
1. Enable debug logging and reproduce the issue
  2. Generate an export: /slh debuglog export
  3. Check integration tests: /slh debuglog test all
  4. Submit the export along with issue details

docs.title: Storage Mechanism
docs.text:
• Memory Buffer: In-memory storage for current session (max 1,000 entries)
  • Saved Variables: Persistent storage through WoW's SavedVariables system
  • Session Management: Automatic cleanup and rotation between game sessions

docs.title: Performance Metrics
docs.text:
• Memory Usage: Real-time tracking of debug system memory consumption
  • Logging Performance: Metrics on logging operation efficiency
  • Buffer Utilization: Monitoring of memory buffer usage patterns

docs.title: Compatibility
docs.text:
• WoW Versions: Full compatibility with current retail WoW
  • Addon Integration: Seamless integration with all SpectrumLootTool modules
  • Performance Testing: Comprehensive testing for raid environment usage

The debug system is a core component of SpectrumLootTool's reliability and maintainability. When in doubt, enable debug logging and generate an export for comprehensive troubleshooting information.

docs.title: Installation Guide
docs.text: Get SpectrumLootTool up and running in World of Warcraft quickly with our comprehensive installation guide.

docs.title: 🎯 Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before installing SpectrumLootTool, ensure you have:

  • World of Warcraft Retail (Current Patch)
  • Spectrum Federation Guild Membership (Garona-US server)
  • Officer Rank (for full functionality)

Guild Requirements

While anyone can install and use the basic features, full officer controls require rank 0-2 in the Spectrum Federation guild.

docs.title: 🚀 Installation Methods
docs.text:
WowUp (Recommended)Manual InstallationDevelopment Version

Download WowUp

Visit wowup.io and download the WowUp client for your operating system.

Open WowUp

Launch WowUp and ensure it has detected your World of Warcraft installation.

Install from URL

Navigate to Addons → Install from URL and enter: 

https://github.com/OsulivanAB/SpectrumLootTool

Install & Update

Click Install and WowUp will automatically download and install the addon. Future updates will be handled automatically!

Download Release

Visit our Releases page and download the latest ZIP file.

Locate AddOns Folder

Find your WoW AddOns directory:

  • Windows: World of Warcraft\_retail_\Interface\AddOns\
  • Mac: Applications/World of Warcraft/_retail_/Interface/AddOns/

Extract Files

Extract the downloaded ZIP file directly into your AddOns folder. You should see a new SpectrumLootTool folder.

Restart WoW

Restart World of Warcraft or use /reload in-game to load the addon.

For developers or testing latest features:

git clone https://github.com/OsulivanAB/SpectrumLootTool.git
cd SpectrumLootTool
# Copy files to your AddOns directory

docs.title: ✅ Verification
docs.text: After installation, verify everything is working:

docs.title: 1. Check Addon Load
docs.text: Open the AddOns menu at character select and ensure Spectrum Loot Helper is listed and enabled.

docs.title: 2. Test Basic Commands
docs.text:
Log into your character and try these commands:

/slh status - Check addon status and configuration /slh help - Display available commands /slh - Toggle the main interface

docs.title: 3. Expected Output
docs.text:
You should see output similar to:

=== SLH Status ===
Guild: Spectrum Federation
Officer: true/false
Version: 0.3.3
WoW Version: 10.2

docs.title: Initial Setup
docs.text:
1. Join/Create a Raid Group - The addon is designed for raid environments
  2. Access Settings - Go to Options → AddOns → Spectrum Loot Helper
  3. Configure Preferences:
  4. Enable "Outside Raid" if you want to use it solo
  5. Unlock frame to reposition the interface
  6. Configure debug logging if needed

docs.title: Officer Permissions
docs.text:
If you're an officer (rank 0-2) in Spectrum Federation, you'll see additional controls:

  • Arrow buttons next to player names for adjusting roll counts
  • Enhanced status information in /slh status
  • Access to officer-only commands

docs.title: Common Issues
docs.text:
Addon Not Loading

Symptoms: Addon doesn't appear in-game

Solutions: - Verify files are in correct AddOns folder - Check character select AddOns menu - Ensure folder is named SpectrumLootTool - Try /reload in-game

No Interface Visible

Symptoms: Commands work but no UI appears

Solutions: - Ensure you're in a raid group (or enable "Outside Raid") - Exit combat before opening interface - Try /slh command to toggle visibility

No Officer Controls

Symptoms: Missing arrow buttons and officer features

Solutions: - Verify guild membership in Spectrum Federation - Check rank (must be 0-2) - Use /slh refresh to update officer status

docs.title: Debug Information
docs.text:
For technical issues, enable debug logging:

/slh debuglog on

Then reproduce the issue and export logs:

/slh debuglog export

Share the exported information when reporting bugs.

docs.title: WowUp Users
docs.text: Updates are handled automatically! WowUp will notify you when new versions are available.

docs.title: Manual Users
docs.text:
1. Check Releases for new versions
  2. Download and extract new version
  3. Replace existing files in AddOns folder
  4. Use /reload in-game

docs.text:

  • Quick Start Guide - Get up and running quickly
  • User Guide - Comprehensive feature overview
  • Configuration - Detailed configuration options

Installation Complete!

Welcome to SpectrumLootTool! Join your raid group and start tracking those BiS rolls! 🎲

docs.title: Quick Start Guide
docs.text: Get up and running with SpectrumLootTool in minutes! This guide covers the essential commands and features you'll use most often.

docs.title: 1. Basic Commands
docs.text:
The most important commands to know:

/slh - Toggle the main loot tracking interface /slh status - Check your addon status and permissions /slh help - Display all available commands

docs.title: 2. Check Your Setup
docs.text:
After installation, verify your configuration:

/slh status

You should see something like:

[2024-01-15 20:30:45] === SLH Status === Guild: Spectrum Federation Officer: true Version: 0.3.3 WoW Version: 10.2

Officer Status

If "Officer: false" but you should have permissions, try /slh refresh to update your status.

docs.title: View Roll Counts
docs.text:
Open the main interface to see current BiS roll counts:

/slh

The interface shows: - Player names (colored by class) - Current roll counts for each player - Real-time updates as counts change

docs.title: Reposition Interface
docs.text:
Unlock the frame to move it around your screen:

  1. Go to Options → AddOns → Spectrum Loot Helper
  2. Check "Unlock Frame"
  3. Drag the interface to your preferred location
  4. Uncheck "Unlock Frame" to lock position

docs.title: Adjust Roll Counts
docs.text:
Officers see arrow buttons next to each player name:

  • ↑ Up Arrow - Increase player's roll count by 1
  • ↓ Down Arrow - Decrease player's roll count by 1

Officer Permissions

You must be rank 0-2 in Spectrum Federation guild to see officer controls.

docs.title: Manual Adjustments
docs.text:
Use commands for precise adjustments:

/slh set PlayerName 5

/slh add PlayerName 2

docs.title: ⚙️ Essential Settings
docs.text: Access settings via Options → AddOns → Spectrum Loot Helper:

docs.title: Outside Raid Usage
docs.text:
• Default: Disabled (raid groups only)
  • Enable: Use addon when solo or in small groups
  • Use Case: Personal tracking outside of raids

docs.title: Frame Position
docs.text:
• Locked (default): Interface position is fixed
  • Unlocked: Drag interface anywhere on screen
  • Auto-save: Position remembered between sessions

docs.title: Show All Players
docs.text:
• Current Group (default): Show only current raid members
  • All Known Players: Display all players from database
  • Use Case: View historical data for offline players

docs.title: View Recent Changes
docs.text:
See what's been happening with roll counts:

/slh debuglog show 10

docs.title: Enable Detailed Logging
docs.text:
For troubleshooting or bug reports:

/slh debuglog on

docs.title: Export Debug Information
docs.text:
When reporting issues:

/slh debuglog export

docs.title: Raid Night Setup
docs.text:
**1. Pre-Raid Check** 
/slh status
/slh refresh
Verify addon is working and permissions are current. **2. Open Interface** 
/slh
Display the loot tracking interface for your raid team. **3. Position UI** Unlock frame if needed and position interface where it won't block important UI elements.

docs.title: Officer Loot Distribution
docs.text: **Item Drops**  When a BiS item drops, check the interface to see who has the most/least rolls.   **Award Loot**  Give the item to the appropriate player based on your guild's loot rules.   **Update Counts**  Use the arrow buttons to decrease the winner's roll count by 1.   **Verify Changes**  Confirm the change is reflected in the interface and synced to other players.

docs.title: Troubleshooting Quick Fixes
docs.text: Issue Quick Fix Interface not showing /slh then ensure you're in raid and out of combat No officer buttons /slh refresh to update guild permissions Data seems wrong /slh debuglog export and check for errors Can't move interface Enable "Unlock Frame" in addon settings Missing players Enable "Show All Players" or invite them to group

docs.title: Keyboard Shortcuts
docs.text:
While there are no built-in hotkeys, you can create macros:

/run SlashCmdList.SLH("")

docs.title: Integration with Other Addons
docs.text: SpectrumLootTool works alongside: - WeakAuras - Can be positioned to complement your WA setup - Details/Skada - No conflicts with damage meters - Guild management addons - Uses standard WoW guild APIs

docs.title: Performance Optimization
docs.text: For optimal performance: - Keep debug logging off during normal use - Use "Current Group" mode instead of "All Players" for large databases - Consider enabling outside raid usage only when needed

docs.title: Example Bug Report
docs.text:
**Bug Description:**
Roll counts not syncing between officers during raid

**Expected Behavior:**
When an officer adjusts a player's roll count, it should immediately 
appear on all other players' interfaces

**Actual Behavior:**
Changes only appear locally, other players see old counts

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Start raid with multiple officers running SLH
2. Officer A adjusts Player X's count using arrow buttons
3. Officer B's interface still shows old count for Player X
4. `/slh refresh` doesn't fix the sync issue

**Environment:**
- SLH Version: 0.3.3
- WoW Version: 10.2.5
- Officers affected: 3/4 in raid
- Regular members: Seeing mixed data

**Debug Info:**
[Paste output from `/slh debuglog export`]

docs.title: Installation & Setup
docs.text:
Q: Can I use SpectrumLootTool in other guilds? A: The addon is designed specifically for Spectrum Federation and requires guild membership for full functionality.

Q: Do I need to be an officer to use the addon? A: No, all guild members can view roll counts. Officer rank (0-2) is only required for adjustment controls.

Q: Why don't I see the interface in dungeons? A: By default, the addon only works in raid groups. Enable "Outside Raid" in settings to use it elsewhere.

docs.title: Functionality
docs.text:
Q: How do roll counts work? A: Lower numbers = higher loot priority. Counts increase when you receive BiS loot and can be adjusted by officers.

Q: Can I see historical data for offline players? A: Yes, enable "Show All Players" in settings to see data for all guild members regardless of online status.

Q: What happens if I leave and rejoin the guild? A: Your roll count data is preserved as long as you rejoin with the same character name.

docs.title: Technical Issues
docs.text:
Q: The addon is causing memory issues, what should I do? A: Enable "Current Group Only" mode, disable debug logging, and consider using /slh reset old to clean up old data.

Q: How do I backup my roll count data? A: Data is automatically saved to SavedVariables. You can export it with /slh debuglog export for backup purposes.

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text: Learn how to use SpectrumLootTool effectively for raid loot tracking and distribution.

docs.title: 🎯 Getting Started
docs.text: SpectrumLootTool is designed to help Spectrum Federation track and distribute loot fairly during raids. The addon displays roll counts for each player and provides tools for officers to manage the loot distribution process.

docs.title: Opening the Interface
docs.text:
Use any of these methods to open the main interface:

/slh - Toggle interface visibility /slh show - Force show interface /slh hide - Force hide interface

docs.title: Interface Layout
docs.text:
The main interface displays:

  1. Player Names - Listed alphabetically, colored by class
  2. Roll Counts - Current BiS roll count for each player
  3. Officer Controls - Arrow buttons (officers only)
  4. Status Indicators - Online/offline status

docs.title: What Are Roll Counts?
docs.text: Roll counts represent how many "BiS" (Best in Slot) items a player has received. The system helps ensure fair loot distribution by tracking who has received the most gear.

docs.title: How Counts Work
docs.text:
• New players start at 0 rolls
  • Receiving BiS loot increases count by 1
  • Officers can adjust counts manually
  • Lower counts = higher loot priority

docs.title: Roll Count Display
docs.text:
PlayerName [5] ↑↓    # Officer view with controls
PlayerName [5]       # Regular member view
PlayerName [5] 📴    # Offline player

docs.title: Viewing Your Status
docs.text:
Check your current roll count and standing:

/slh status - Show your addon status and roll count /slh me - Show only your information

docs.title: Understanding Your Position
docs.text:
• Lower numbers = higher loot priority
  • Same numbers = equal priority (use traditional rolling)
  • Offline players still count in distribution decisions

docs.title: During Raids
docs.text:
1. Keep interface open to see current standings
  2. Check priorities when loot drops
  3. Roll normally if priorities are tied
  4. Be patient while officers make adjustments

docs.title: 🛡️ For Officers
docs.text:
Officer Permissions Required

You must be rank 0-2 in Spectrum Federation to access officer controls.

docs.title: Officer Interface
docs.text:
Officers see additional controls:

  • ↑ Up Arrow - Increase player's roll count by 1
  • ↓ Down Arrow - Decrease player's roll count by 1
  • Enhanced status information in commands

docs.title: Using Arrow Buttons
docs.text:
1. Click ↑ next to a player's name to increase their count
  2. Click ↓ next to a player's name to decrease their count
  3. Changes sync immediately to all addon users

docs.title: Using Commands
docs.text: /slh set PlayerName 3 - Set player to exactly 3 rolls /slh add PlayerName 2 - Add 2 to player's current count /slh subtract PlayerName 1 - Remove 1 from player's count

docs.title: Loot Distribution Process
docs.text: **Loot Drops**  When a BiS item drops, check the interface to see current roll counts and priorities.   **Determine Eligibility**  Consider factors like: - Current roll counts (lower = higher priority) - Item upgrade significance - Player attendance and contribution - Guild loot rules   **Award Loot**  Give the item to the chosen player using standard loot distribution methods.   **Update Counts**  Use the ↓ arrow button or command to decrease the winner's roll count by 1.   **Verify Sync**  Confirm the change appears on all players' interfaces and is properly synchronized.

docs.title: Repositioning the Interface
docs.text:
1. Go to Options → AddOns → Spectrum Loot Helper
  2. Check "Unlock Frame"
  3. Drag the interface to your preferred location
  4. Uncheck "Unlock Frame" to lock the position

docs.title: Handling Offline Players
docs.text:
• Offline players remain visible with a 📴 indicator
  • Their counts still matter for loot distribution
  • Officers can adjust offline player counts
  • Enable "Show All Players" to see full guild roster

docs.title: Dealing with New Players
docs.text:
• New guild members start at 0 rolls automatically
  • Officers can set starting counts if needed for fairness
  • Use /slh set PlayerName X to establish baseline

docs.title: Resolving Disputes
docs.text:
If there are questions about roll counts:

  1. Check the debug log for recent changes
  2. Use /slh debuglog show 10 to see last 10 events
  3. Export logs with /slh debuglog export if needed
  4. Reset individual players if data corruption is suspected

docs.title: Show/Hide Features
docs.text:
Access via Options → AddOns → Spectrum Loot Helper:

  • Show Outside Raid - Use addon when not in a raid group
  • Show Offline Players - Include offline guild members
  • Show All Players - Display entire database vs. current group only
  • Auto-Hide in Combat - Hide interface during encounters

docs.title: Visual Customization
docs.text:
• UI Scale - Adjust interface size (50% - 200%)
  • Transparency - Make interface semi-transparent
  • Class Colors - Toggle class-colored player names

docs.title: Sort Methods
docs.text:
• Alphabetical (default) - A-Z by player name
  • Roll Count - Lowest to highest counts
  • Reverse Roll Count - Highest to lowest counts

docs.title: Filtering Options
docs.text:
• Current Group Only - Show only current raid members
  • Guild Members - Show all guild members regardless of online status
  • Hide Zero Counts - Hide players with no rolls

docs.title: Macro Integration
docs.text:
Create macros for quick access:

-- Toggle interface
/run SLH:Toggle()

-- Quick status check
/run SLH:PrintStatus()

-- Officer quick adjust (replace PlayerName and amount)
/run if SLH:IsOfficer() then SLH:AdjustPlayer("PlayerName", -1) end

docs.title: Keyboard Shortcuts
docs.text:
While SLH doesn't have built-in hotkeys, you can:

  1. Assign macros to action bar slots
  2. Use keybind addons to assign shortcuts
  3. Create custom hotkeys through WoW's interface

docs.title: Integration with Other Addons
docs.text:
SpectrumLootTool works well with:

  • Loot council addons - Can inform decision making
  • Damage meters - No conflicts, complementary data
  • Guild management tools - Uses standard WoW APIs
  • WeakAuras - Can trigger on loot events

docs.title: Interface Not Showing
docs.text:
Symptoms: Commands work but no UI visible

Solutions: - Ensure you're in a raid group OR enable "Outside Raid" - Exit combat before opening interface - Check if frame is positioned off-screen - Try /slh reset ui to reset interface position

docs.title: Data Inconsistencies
docs.text:
Symptoms: Roll counts don't match between players

Solutions: - Use /slh refresh to force data sync - Check guild permissions with /slh status - Export debug logs for analysis - Consider data reset for affected players

docs.title: Performance Issues
docs.text:
Symptoms: Interface is slow or unresponsive

Solutions: - Reduce UI scale if very large - Enable "Current Group Only" mode - Disable debug logging if enabled - Consider addon conflicts with /reload

docs.title: Getting Help
docs.text:
1. Check documentation - Most issues are covered here
  2. Use debug commands - /slh debuglog export for technical issues
  3. Contact officers - Guild leadership can help with permissions
  4. Report bugs - Use GitHub issues for technical problems

Ready to Raid!

You now understand the basics of SpectrumLootTool. Practice with the interface outside of raids to get comfortable with the controls before your next raid night!
